etymology.description: 月(月) (yuè, "moon; month") as semantic indicator related to the body + 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") as phonetic component = refers to the body's belly area
etymology.interpretation: In 肚(肚) (dù, "stomach; belly"), 月(月) (yuè, "moon; month") acts as a semantic indicator, symbolizing a part of the body, while 土(土) (tǔ, "earth") provides the pronunciation. The combination suggests a bodily area similar in shape to the roundness of the earth.

examples.chinese: 饭后他轻轻拍了拍肚(飯後他輕輕拍了拍肚)。
examples.pinyin: Fàn hòu tā qīngqīng pāi le pāi dù.
examples.english: After the meal, he lightly patted his stomach.

examples.chinese: 吃完饭(吃完飯)，他的肚开始咕咕叫(他的肚開始咕咕叫)。
examples.pinyin: Chī wán fàn, tā de dù kāishǐ gūgū jiào.
examples.english: After eating, his stomach started to rumble.
